intro: Oestlundorchis falcata subsp. velatoides, commonly known as the velvety twayblade, is a terrestrial orchid belonging to the family Orchidaceae. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and a single, pale green to yellowish flower spike. The plant is native to parts of Europe, particularly in southern regions such as Spain and Italy. It typically grows in moist, calcareous soils in woodland or grassland habitats. Oestlundorchis falcata subsp. velatoides is a rare and endangered species, requiring specific environmental conditions for successful growth and reproduction.
